content.question:
Reaction 1: 

<math alttext="C O gas plus 3 H 2 gas is in equilibrium with C H 4 gas plus H 2 O gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="K sub 1 equals the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of C H 4 times the molar concentration of H 2 O and denominator the molar concentration of C O times the molar concentration of H 2 cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>][H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[CO][H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Reaction 2: 

<math alttext="C O 2 gas plus H 2 gas is in equilibrium with C O gas plus H 2 O gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><mtext>CO</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="K sub 2 equals the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of C O times the molar concentration of H 2 O and denominator the molar concentration of C O 2 times the molar concentration of H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>CO</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>][H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>][H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Reaction 3: 

<math alttext="C H 4 gas plus 2 H 2 O gas is in equilibrium with C O 2 gas plus 4 H 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mspace></mspace><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="K sub 3 equals question mark" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 

The chemical equations and equilibrium expressions for two reactions at the same temperature are given above. Based on the information, which of the following expressions can be used to calculate the value of <math alttext="K sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for reaction 3 at the same temperature?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub 3 equals negative K sub 1 plus negative K sub 2" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></math>

<math alttext="K sub 3 equals negative K sub 1 minus negative K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mtext>(</mtext><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub 3 equals K sub 1 times K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>×</mo><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub 3 equals the fraction 1 over K sub 1, end fraction, times the fraction 1 over K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub 3 equals the fraction 1 over K sub 1, end fraction, times the fraction 1 over K sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.A: Identify quantities needed to solve a problem from given information (e.g., text, mathematical expressions, graphs, or tables).
